channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Coast Guard pursues oil tanker Trump administration says evaded Venezuela blockade
item.description: The Trump administration continued its pressure campaign against Venezuela's president over the weekend, enforcing a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers traveling to and from the country.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration continued its pressure campaign against Venezuela's president over the weekend, enforcing a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers traveling to and from the country.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Rep. Adam Smith says Trump's oil blockade is about power over Venezuela
item.description: Rep. Adam Smith, the Democratic leader of the Armed Services Committee, says Trump's oil blockade is about driving Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power more than anything.
item.content:encoded:
Rep. Adam Smith, the Democratic leader of the Armed Services Committee, says Trump's oil blockade is about driving Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power more than anything.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Japan preparing to restart the world's largest nuclear power plant
item.description: A local government in Japan voted Monday to restart the world's largest nuclear power plant, which has been closed since 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster.
item.content:encoded: A local government in Japan voted Monday to restart the world's largest nuclear power plant, which has been closed since 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: A prickly Ralph Fiennes uplifts a town through music during WWI in 'The Choral'
item.description: A northern English town loses its best choral singers to fighting in World War I but finds new hope in a time of loss through music in Nicholas Hytner's new film "The Choral," featuring Ralph Fiennes.
item.content:encoded:
A northern English town loses its best choral singers to fighting in World War I but finds new hope in a time of loss through music in Nicholas Hytner's new film "The Choral," featuring Ralph Fiennes.

(Image credit: Nicola Dove)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: NPR analysis shows skyrocketing number of 'no-shows' in immigration court
item.description: More immigrants are not showing up for their mandatory immigration court hearings compared to prior years, an NPR analysis shows, allowing the government to order their immediate deportation.
item.content:encoded:
More immigrants are not showing up for their mandatory immigration court hearings compared to prior years, an NPR analysis shows, allowing the government to order their immediate deportation.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Some patients face hurdles getting HIV prevention drugs. Here's what to know
item.description: A daily preventive pill can be invaluable for people at risk for HIV. But some doctors don't know much about prescribing them. And billing headaches are common. Here's how to overcome those hurdles.
item.content:encoded: A daily preventive pill can be invaluable for people at risk for HIV. But some doctors don't know much about prescribing them. And billing headaches are common. Here's how to overcome those hurdles.
item.dc:creator: Zach Dyer

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump intensifies blockade of Venezuela-linked oil tankers, DOJ releases more Epstein files, but lawmakers blast delay, analysis shows skyrocketing amount of "no shows" in immigration courts.
item.content:encoded: Trump intensifies blockade of Venezuela-linked oil tankers, DOJ releases more Epstein files, but lawmakers blast delay, analysis shows skyrocketing amount of "no shows" in immigration courts.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Church of England launches holiday ad to counter far-right Christian nationalism
item.description: Christian nationalists vow to put "Christ back into Christmas." In response, the Church of England has launched a holiday ad campaign to counter the far-right appropriation of Christian symbols.
item.content:encoded: Christian nationalists vow to put "Christ back into Christmas." In response, the Church of England has launched a holiday ad campaign to counter the far-right appropriation of Christian symbols.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: 'The Nutcracker' helps keep the lights on for American ballet companies
item.description: About half of the revenue for American ballet companies each year comes from the cozy seasonal favorite "The Nutcracker." Since COVID, they have become even more dependent on those sugarplum fairies.
item.content:encoded: About half of the revenue for American ballet companies each year comes from the cozy seasonal favorite "The Nutcracker." Since COVID, they have become even more dependent on those sugarplum fairies.
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Turning Point USA's conference exposes underlying rifts in the Republican Party
item.description: Division over the future of the Republican Party were on display this weekend as conservatives gathered for Turning Point USA's "AmericaFest" conference in Phoenix, Arizona.
item.content:encoded: Division over the future of the Republican Party were on display this weekend as conservatives gathered for Turning Point USA's "AmericaFest" conference in Phoenix, Arizona.
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore
